column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/933e9a6a4603f4e23e7572397f30fbb9628bf3c6 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
This looks like it can be easily broken by an overflow :(\n
@laanwj If GetBlockValue returns > 2^64/1000, yours overflows undetectably. I think @il--ya 's is sound, though.\n

Oh crap, of course, the multiply can overflow too. Well that reinforces my point that writing code that handles overflows in C/C++ is just horribly frustrating.\nEdit: so yes, @il--ya's suggestion is better.\n
